Manifest.Name: Microsoft System Center Web Monitoring Library

DisplayString.Name: $TemplateConfig/Name$
DisplayString.Description: $TemplateConfig/Description$

DisplayString.Name: $TemplateConfig/Name$ Discovery
DisplayString.Description: Discovery rule for $TemplateConfig/Name$

DisplayString.Name: $TemplateConfig/Name$ Watcher Group Discovery
DisplayString.Description: Discovery for $TemplateConfig/Name$ watcher computers

DisplayString.Name: $TemplateConfig/Name$ watcher computers group
DisplayString.Description: Group of $TemplateConfig/Name$ watcher computers

DisplayString.Name: Performance Collection: Transaction response time
DisplayString.Description: Performance counter collection rule for Transaction response time

DisplayString.Name: Web Application - $TemplateConfig/Name$
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for the all the requests of a Web Application.

DisplayString.Name: Web Application - $TemplateConfig/Name$
DisplayString.Description: This alert was generated by the aggregate monitor. Please open the health explorer to identify the monitors which contributed to this alert.

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Request - $TemplateConfig/Name$
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for the initial request of a Web Application.

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Request - $TemplateConfig/Name$
DisplayString.Description: This alert was generated by the aggregate monitor. Please open the health explorer to identify the monitors which contributed to this alert.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for the Base Page

DisplayString.Name: SSL Monitoring
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for all SSL monitors on the Base Page.

DisplayString.Name: Links on Base Page
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for all Link monitors on the Base Page

DisplayString.Name: Resources on Base Page
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for all Resource monitors on the Base Page

DisplayString.Name: Total Data on Base Page
DisplayString.Description: Aggregate roll-up monitor for all Total monitors on the Base Page

DisplayString.Name: Page Unreachable
DisplayString.Description: The base page was unreachable.

DisplayString.Name: Error Code Failure
DisplayString.Description: A probe error occurred while processing the request

DisplayString.Name: DNS Resolution Failure
DisplayString.Description: Unable to resolve name via DNS

DisplayString.Name: Status Code
DisplayString.Description: Status Code failure

DisplayString.Name: SSL Certificate Expired
DisplayString.Description: SSL Certificate has expired

DisplayString.Name: Untrusted CA
DisplayString.Description: The SSL Certificate Authority is not trusted.

DisplayString.Name: Certificate CN Invalid
DisplayString.Description: The certificate CN is invalid

DisplayString.Name: Links Status Code
DisplayString.Description: Checks the Status Code of each link in MOM.

DisplayString.Name: Resources Status Code
DisplayString.Description: Checks the Status Code at a large scale.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page Error Code Failure
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects occurred probe errors while processing the request.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page DNS Resolution Failure
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects DNS resolution failures requesting the base page.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page Unreachable
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects failures to reach the base page.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page SSL Certificate Expired
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects if the SSL certificate has expired.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page SSL Certificate CN Invalid
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects if the CN for the base pages SSL certificate is valid.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page SSL Certificate CA Unstrusted
DisplayString.Description: This monitor checks if the CA that issued the Base Page SSL Certificate is a trusted Root Authority

DisplayString.Name: Content Match
DisplayString.Description: This monitor searches the response body and attempts to match it to user specified criteria.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page Status Code
DisplayString.Description: This monitor checks the Base Page Status Code

DisplayString.Name: Links Status Code
DisplayString.Description: This monitor checks the Status Code for links on the base page.

DisplayString.Name: Resources Status Code
DisplayString.Description: This monitor checks the Status Code for Resources on the base page.

DisplayString.Name: Transaction Response Numeric Monitor
DisplayString.Description: This monitor is used to threshold on transaction response time.

DisplayString.Name: Numeric Monitor
DisplayString.Description: This monitor is used to threshold on numeric values like Time To First Byte.

DisplayString.Name: Custom Criteria
DisplayString.Description: This monitor is a custom monitor created based on the criteria supplied in the Web Application Editor.

DisplayString.Name: Base Page DNS Resolution Time
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects if the DNS resolution time for the base page is taking too long.

DisplayString.Name: Links DNS Resolution Time
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects if the DNS resolution time for all links is taking too long.

DisplayString.Name: Total DNS Resolution Time
DisplayString.Description: This monitor detects the total DNS resolution time over all requets is taking too long.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rolls up health from all the individual monitors for the whole Web Application

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rolls up health from all the individual monitors for each request in this Web Application

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rolls up health from all the individual monitors monitoring SSL certificates on the target URL

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rolls up health from all the individual monitors for link in each request in this Web Application

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rolls up health from all the individual monitors for resources in each request in this Web Application

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rolls up health from all the individual monitors for the total health of the Web Application

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The target URL is unavailable

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The target URL is down for maintenance or unavailable
There is a firewall between the watcher node and the URL
System proxy settings are not set for the watcher node

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: Ping the target URL to ensure it's on the network
Configure the system proxy settings on each of the watcher nodes

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: An error was encountered while processing an URL.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The page is unreachable. If behind a proxy, check if the proxy settings are correct.
Unexpected API call failures. Multiple reasons could cause this, for instance a memory allocation error.
The site or URL is not accessible or is down.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Try to access the same URL from an internet browser like Internet Explorer.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Could not resolve the user supplied URL through the watcher nodes Domain Name Service.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The DNS client side cache has a stale entry
The DNS infrastructure not available
The watcher node DNS settings are out of date or incorrect
DNS has a stale entry for the supplied target name and is returning the wrong IP address

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: On a Windows Computer, at the command line type:
ipconfig /flushdns
Then type:
ipconfig /registerdns
Check with your network or domain administrator if there is any problems with the DNS infrastructure that the watcher node is configured to use.
Check the URL can be pinged. Note that in some cases, the network path from the watcher node to the URL may not allow ICMP, so ping may fail.
Do this by pinging by the URL name you supplied in the wizard. Type ping -a [URL]. For example, if the IP Address is www.microsoft.com:

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Status code does not match the supplied criteria

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The target URL is offline
The watcher node doesn't have the appropriate permissions
There may be a firewall between the watcher node and the target device

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: Open IE to confirm that the target URL is online
Ensure that the Run As account used by the watcher node has the appropriate permissions to the target data source
Check if the Windows Firewall is enabled on either the target machine or the watcher node. If it is, create an exclusion for the application you are monitoring.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: SSL Certificate has Expired

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The servers servicing this URL has an expired SSL Certificate

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Contact the administrator of the URL to update their SSL certificate

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: SSL Certificate CA Root not trusted

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen when the target URL is not using an SSL certificate that is signed by a public internet root CA.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Contact the administrator of the URL to use a publicly signed SSL certificate or add the Certificate to the watcher nodes trusted root CA store if you are in fact sure you should be trusting this source. For example if you have an internal Root CA that supplies SSL certificates.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The CN for this Certificate is invalid

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen when the certificate is invalid

maml:listItem.maml:para: The watcher node doesn't have the appropriate permissions

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Contact the administrator of the URL to ensure they have a properly configured SSL certificate.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: One of the links on this page does not match the status code criteria

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen when one or more links on the page results in a status code that doesn't match the criteria provided by the wizard by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Edit the web application monitoring from the Authoring space and check the criteria for links

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: One of the resources on this page does not match the status code criteria

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen when one or more resources (e.g. images, cascading style sheets, scripts, etc...) on the page results in a status code that doesn't match the criteria provided by the wizard by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Edit the web application monitoring from the Authoring space and check the criteria for links

DisplayString.Name: Computer hosts Web Application Perspective
DisplayString.Description: Computer hosts Web Application Perspective

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Monitoring Library
DisplayString.Description: Microsoft System Center Web Application Monitoring Library: This Management Pack contains the components need to monitor Web Applications and record browser sessions. Recording a browser session allows you to create a rich Synthetic Transaction to imitate exactly how users interact with the application you need to monitor.

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Perspective
DisplayString.Description: Url Perspective

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Perspective Group
DisplayString.Description: Group of Url Perspective

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Transaction Monitoring
DisplayString.Description: This template allows you to create monitoring for a simple Web Application. You can use the Web Application Recorder at the end of this Wizard to record a browser session as well as edit existing monitoring for your Web Application.
